description.value:
Peering into a crystal ball, magic mirror, or scrying pool, you attempt to summon a scrying sensor to watch a creature from afar. A creature that can see invisible objects sees the sensor as a luminous orb about the size of your fist.

Materials: You require a focus worth 750 gp, such as a @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-spells.Item.su1NX3sjg60sGC89]{crystal ball}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-spells.Item.tbUsbM8dM8qV3ZYz]{magic mirror}, or scrying pool.

Summoning Spell

You can target a creature or location you've been to before, which can be anywhere on the same plane of existence as you. You don't need line of sight. When targeting a location, it always succeeds (unless divination magic doesn't function in the area), and a scrying sensor is created in the location and doesn't move.

When targeting a creature, the target makes a save.

Charisma Save

  • Failure: A scrying sensor is created within 10 feet of the target. The sensor follows the target for the duration, remaining within 10 feet.

  • Success: No effect, and you can't use this spell against it for 24 hours.

  • The target's save is modified by how well you know them and the physical connection you have to them, based on the following tables:

Knowledge of Target
KnowledgeSave Modifier
Secondhand (you have heard of the target)+5
Firsthand (you have met the target)+0
Familiar (you know the target well)-5
Connection to Target
ConnectionSave Modifier
Likeness or picture-2
Possession or garment-4
Body part, lock of hair, bit of nail, or the like-10

Scrying Sensor

  • The sensor is a tiny &reference[construct]{construct} that is always &reference[invisible]. It looks like a small luminous orb to creatures who can see it.

  • The sensor is immune to all conditions (except invisible) and damage. Creatures and objects pass through it harmlessly. The sensor can be @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-spells.Item.oZwKW3I3yzrSdpLE]{dispelled}.

  • You can see through the sensor by peering into your crystal ball, magic mirror, or scrying pool. The sensor has no senses of its own, but you can use your senses (such as Darkvision) as if in the sensor's location. You cannot see a creature or object protected from divination with the sensor.

source.value:
You can see and hear a particular creature you choose that is on the same plane of existence as you. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw, which is modified by how well you know the target and the sort of physical connection you have to it. If a target knows you're casting this spell, it can fail the saving throw voluntarily if it wants to be observed.

Knowledge of Target
KnowledgeSave Modifier
Secondhand (you have heard of the target)+5
Firsthand (you have met the target)+0
Familiar (you know the target well)-5
Connection to Target
ConnectionSave Modifier
Likeness or picture-2
Possession or garment-4
Body part, lock of hair, bit of nail, or the like-10

On a successful save, the target isn't affected, and you can't use this spell against it again for 24 hours.

On a failed save, the spell creates an invisible sensor within 10 feet of the target. You can see and hear through the sensor as if you were there. The sensor moves with the target, remaining within 10 feet of it for the duration. A creature that can see invisible objects sees the sensor as a luminous orb about the size of your fist.

Instead of targeting a creature, you can choose a location you have seen before as the target of this spell. When you do, the sensor appears at that location and doesn't move.

a focus worth at least 1,000 gp, such as a crystal ball, a silver mirror, or a font filled with holy water
